body: trying different videos gives the same results so far
For some reason it can't delete the temp folder according to your screenshot. It didn't even reach waifu2x.

>i'm unclear on where the log is but here's this for now

@sryug all logs in the same directory where your video2x.py - `video2x/bin/`. Their names are like `error_log_%date%-%number%.%number%`

> > i'm unclear on where the log is but here's this for now
> 
> @sryug all logs in the same directory where your video2x.py - `video2x/bin/`. Their names are like `error_log_%date%-%number%.%number%`

Could you please post the error log content?

I don't seem to have that.
![error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48486738/54476657-fa04d800-47cd-11e9-9dbd-9a522d1757be.JPG).

it is successfully deleting the temp folder though.  I've watched it run, fill out the folder with images then poof disappear once it hits 50% and claims it has completed the operation.

@sryug which graphics card do you have? I had the same behavior on my nvidia grahics card when I tried to use gpu upscaling method without installed CUDA Toolkit.
ok then try to download and install this - [CUDA Toolkit 10.1](https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda-downloads?target_os=Windows&target_arch=x86_64).
I just did and it did not fix the issue.  I used the network installer from the page

@sryug in your very first message on the bottom of screenshot Permission Error has occured. But command prompt has runned with administrator rights. Hm... Maybe something is blocking this folder. I not sure.
Did you try any other video to upscale? Try to upscale [demo sample](https://files.flexio.org/Resources/Videos/sample_input.mp4) for example

the sample video gives the same results.  i've done a bunch of different videos of different lengths and get the same exact result every time. it cuts out at 50% progress.
![half](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48486738/54480134-e455d980-47f2-11e9-855e-3e5f614b30cd.JPG)

I don't understand what is happening at 50% is the program starting some new operation at that point?  according to the command line it has only finished upscaling half the images that it extracted. so I assume it is not even at the point where it recompiles it all into a video.
Is there a way to change the temp folder?  I can set it to my desktop or C: and see how that goes.

>Is there a way to change the temp folder?

I only know that in config file (video2x.json) you may specify `input_path` and `output_path`. Note that you need to escape backslashes in paths like that: `C:\\Users\\th3_smart\\`

I succeeded in changing the temp folder. you have to edit the line at the bottom "video2x_cache_folder" change the false statement into whatever file path you want.

unfortunately this didn't solve the issue

also I now realize it is not actually failing at 50% that is just the workload spread across two threads.  so it's actually getting to 100% in upscaling the frames but fails to compile them into a video.

> also I now realize it is not actually failing at 50% that is just the workload spread across two threads. so it's actually getting to 100% in upscaling the frames but fails to compile them into a video.

@sryug it IS actually failing at 50%. Progress of both threads are calculated.

> Upscaling Progress: 50%|#########9 | 293/588 [05:54<05:20, 1.09s/it]?
> ????????
> ?????????
> 2019-03-16 10:09:09.978503 [+] INFO: [upscaler] Thread 0 exiting
> 2019-03-16 10:09:10.110503 [+] INFO: [upscaler] Thread 1 exiting
> [+] INFO: Upscaling completed
> [+] INFO: Converting extracted frames into video

The `???????` is error message printed in Japanese since waifu2x-caffe output is in Japanese. You'll have to change your cmd codec, otherwise we won't be getting any useful information out of that.
ok. I don't know what that means could you point me in the right direction?

> > i'm unclear on where the log is but here's this for now
> 
> @sryug all logs in the same directory where your video2x.py - `video2x/bin/`. Their names are like `error_log_%date%-%number%.%number%`

Not quite. Most logs are only printed on screen to both stdout and stderr. Only Nvidia errors will be saved to the log format that you mentioned.
